Benchmark Multiple Learners on Multiple Tasks

Source: R/benchmark.R

Runs a benchmark of the cross-product of learners, tasks, and resampling strategies (possibly in parallel).

benchmark(tasks, learners, resamplings, measures = NULL,
  ctrl = exec_control())

Arguments

tasks

[list of Task]:
List of objects of type Task.
learners

[list of Learner]:
List of objects of type Learner.
resamplings

[list of Resampling]:
List of objects of type Resampling.
measures

[list of Measure]:
List of performance measures used to assess the predictive performance. Defaults to the respective measures stored in task.
ctrl

[named list as returned by exec_control()]:
Object to control experiment execution. See exec_control().

Value

BenchmarkResult.

Examples

set.seed(123)
tasks = mlr_tasks$mget(c("iris", "sonar"))
learners = mlr_learners$mget(c("classif.dummy", "classif.rpart"))
resamplings = mlr_resamplings$mget(c("holdout", "cv"))
measures = mlr_measures$mget(c("acc", "time_train"))
bmr = benchmark(tasks, learners, resamplings, measures)
#> Running learner 'classif.rpart' on task 'sonar (iteration 8/10)' ...

# Overview of of resamplings that were conducted internally
rrs = bmr$resample_results
print(rrs)
#>                hash task_id    learner_id resampling_id  N
#> 1: 0871f3203495a223    iris classif.dummy            cv 10
#> 2: 12211bd028dc0b96   sonar classif.dummy       holdout  1
#> 3: 22c5ff6e7bcb9680    iris classif.rpart            cv 10
#> 4: 3231323c696f33a4   sonar classif.dummy            cv 10
#> 5: 7010e0c271223e35   sonar classif.rpart            cv 10
#> 6: 70ee6246f6f933da   sonar classif.rpart       holdout  1
#> 7: 8c4d553709eae2b3    iris classif.dummy       holdout  1
#> 8: fdfa483e082c1801    iris classif.rpart       holdout  1

# Extract first ResampleResult
rr = bmr$resample_result(hash = rrs$hash[1])
# print(rr)

# Extract predictions of first experiment of this resampling
rr$experiment(1)$prediction
#>      id  response      truth
#>  1:   4 virginica     setosa
